snippet: The Chelsea captain John Terry staunchly defended himself at his trial in London, denying prosecutors’ suggestions that he racially abused a black opponent.
abstract: Chelsea soccer captain John Terry staunchly defends himself at his trial in London, denying prosecutors’ suggestions that he racially abused black opponent Anton Ferdinand of Queens Park Rangers during a game; other soccer items noted.
lead_paragraph: The Chelsea captain John Terry staunchly defended himself at his trial in London, denying prosecutors’ suggestions that he racially abused a black opponent.
